page.title: 04RELIGION IN CHARLBURY
page.content: There are many forms of worship in the area; Baptist,Methodist,Catholic and Anglican churches are found.There is also a Quaker group.Quakers founded this school. The daughter of Thomas Downer,Vicar of Charlbury,was born in 1624 and she later became the first woman preacher. Many people joined the Quaker movement after listening to her.Robert Spendlove who also built the Corner House,gave land for a Meeting House in 1779. He also donated 100 pounds to start a Charlbury School. Robert Spendlove died in 1822 and is buried in the old Meeting House which is now an office. Quakers today meet in the Corner House.
